attributes.action: Leave on WTO terms if a deal is not reached by May 22nd
attributes.additional_details: A labour brexit is NOT brexit and neither is the Withdrawal agreement, The UK should not remain a member of the EU after May 22nd. A WTO deal means we take back control of our fishing grounds, A skill-based immigration policy, no longer paying the EU any money saving 10bn and we will be able to trade on the world market however the Withdrawal agreement and labours proposed plan does not allow us to do these.
attributes.background: The government should leave the EU without a deal if a deal is not agreed by may 22nd, By then it will be nearly 8 weeks since the proposed leave date of March 29th. The government should NOT have cross-party talks with the Labour Party to try and get a customs union deal through.
